title: $:/litClock/times/-17:00-Daphne du Maurier
quote_first: We motored, I remember, leaving London in the morning in a heavy shower of rain, coming to Manderley about
quote_last: , in time for tea. I can see myself now, unsuitably dressed as usual, although a bride of seven weeks, in a tan-coloured stockinette frock, a small fur known as a stone marten round my neck, and over all a shapeless mackintosh, far too big for me and dragging to my ankles.
